info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GUERNSEY... MONROE...SOUTHWESTERN BELMONT...NOBLE...NORTHWESTERN WETZEL AND MARSHALL COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM EDT... At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Caldwell, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... New Martinsville, Woodsfield, Caldwell, Quaker City, Sardis, Senecaville, Beallsville, Clarington, Summerfield, Lewisville, Sarahsville, Jerusalem, Salesville, Wilson, Cameron, Fly, Somerton, Antioch, Stafford, and Graysville. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 30 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
